text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The candidate answer explicitly addresses the judicial route available at the national level, which is the prerequisite for invoking EU law principles like direct effect. Specifically, under section 2.2, it advises the user to seek a national judicial remedy and states: 'Ask for a *preliminary ruling* from the Luxembourg courts to the Court of Justice of the EU (CJEU). The national court can refer the question \u201cDoes this Luxembourg amendment contravene the GDPR?\u201d to the CJEU under Article 267 TFEU. The CJEU\u2019s answer will be binding on Luxembourg and, by extension, on the EU.' This directly explains the mechanism by which national courts apply EU law (via the preliminary ruling procedure) over domestic rules, satisfying the criterion.", "criterion_id": "38ca85f5-5bc9-4df7-870e-06603d42d588"}
